requests.name: Get Metrics
requests.description: Get the list of actively reporting metrics from a given time until now. This endpoint is not available in the Python and Ruby libraries.

requests.name: Add Series
requests.description:
The metrics end-point allows you to post time-series data that can be
          graphed on Datadog's dashboards.

queryParams.description: Note that the timestamp should be in seconds, must be current, and the numeric value is a 32bit float gauge-type value.

requests.name: Get Query
requests.description: This end point allows you to query for metrics from any time period.

queryParams.description:
the type of recurrence. Choose from: days, weeks,
              months, years.

how often to repeat as an integer. For example to repeat every 3 days, select
                a type of days and a period of 3.
(optional) a list of week days to repeat on. Choose from: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat or Sun. Only applicable when type is weeks. First letter must be capitalized.

(optional) how many times the downtime will be rescheduled.
                until_occurences and until_date are mutually exclusive

(optional) the date at which the recurrence should end as a POSIX timestmap.
                until_occurences and until_date are mutually exclusive

the type of recurrence. Choose from: days, weeks,
              months, years.

how often to repeat as an integer. For example to repeat every 3 days, select
                a type of days and a period of 3.
(optional) a list of week days to repeat on. Choose from: Mon, Tue, Wed, Thu, Fri, Sat or Sun. Only applicable when type is weeks. First letter must be capitalized.

(optional) how many times the downtime will be rescheduled.
                until_occurences and until_date are mutually exclusive

(optional) the date at which the recurrence should end as a POSIX timestmap.
                until_occurences and until_date are mutually exclusive

requests.name: Get Screen
requests.description: Fetch all of your screenboards' definitions.

requests.name: Get Screen Share Board
requests.description: Share an existing screenboard's with a public URL.

requests.name: Get Tags Hosts
requests.description: Return a mapping of tags to hosts for your whole infrastructure.

requests.name: Get Tags Hosts Host Name
requests.description: Return the list of tags that apply to a given host.

requests.name: Add Tags Hosts Host Name
requests.description: This end point allows you to add tags to a host.

requests.name: Put Tags Hosts Host Name
requests.description: This end point allows you to update all tags for a given host.

requests.name: Delete Tags Hosts Host Name
requests.description: This end point allows you to remove all tags for a given host.

requests.name: Add Comments
requests.description:
Comments are essentially special forms of events that
          appear in the stream. They can start a new discussion thread or
          optionally, reply in another thread.

queryParams.description: can be used instead of metric_query. The JSON document uses the grammar defined here and should be formatted to a single line then URLEncoded. The graph_def argument is only available in the REST API and not using the Ruby or Python wrappers.
time_aggr avg, sum, max, min, change, or pct_change

last_#m (5, 10, 15, or 30),
              last_#h (1, 2, or 4), or last_1d
avg, sum, min, or max
one or more tags (comma-separated), or *

a 'key' in key:value tag syntax; defines a
              separate alert for each tag in the group (multi-alert)

an integer or decimal number used to set the
              threshold
change, pct_change
avg, sum, max, min

#m_ago (5, 10, 15, or 30),
              #h_ago (1, 2, or 4), or 1d_ago
name of the check, e.g. datadog.agent.up

must be at >= your max threshold (defined
              in the options). e.g. if you want to notify on 1
              critical, 3 ok and 2 warn statuses count should be 3.

, the event query string:
                
                  
string_query free text query to match against event title and text.
event sources (comma-separated).
event statuses (comma-separated). Valid options: error, warn, and info.
event priorities (comma-separated). Valid options: low, normal, all.
event reporting host (comma-separated).
exluded event tags (comma-separated).
the stats rollup method. count is the only supported method now.
the timeframe to roll up the counts. Examples: 60s, 4h. Supported timeframes: s, m, h and d.

dictionary of scopes to timestamps or
              None. Each scope will be muted until the given POSIX
              timestamp or forever if the value is None.
              Default: None
              Examples:

                

                  To mute the alert completely:
                      {'*': None}

for a short time:
                      {'role:db': 1412798116}

a boolean indicating whether this
              monitor will notify when data stops reporting.
              Default: false

the number of minutes before a
              monitor will notify when data stops reporting. Must be at least
              2x the monitor timeframe for metric alerts or 2 minutes for
              service checks.
              Default: 2x timeframe for metric alerts, 2 minutes for
              service checks

the number of hours of the monitor not
              reporting data before it will automatically resolve from a
              triggered state.
              Default: None

a boolean indicating whether
              this monitor needs a full window of data before it's evaluated. We
              highly recommend you set this to False for sparse
              metrics, otherwise some evaluations will be skipped.
              Default: True for "on average", "at all times" and
              "in total" aggregation. False otherwise.

the number of minutes after
              the last notification before a monitor will re-notify on the
              current status. It will only re-notify if it's not resolved.
              Default: None

a message to include with a
              re-notification. Supports the '@username' notification we allow
              elsewhere. Not applicable if renotify_interval is
              None.
              Default: None

a boolean indicating whether tagged
              users will be notified on changes to this monitor.
              Default: False

a boolean indicating whether changes to
              to this monitor should be restricted to the creator or admins.
              Default: False

a boolean indicating whether
              notifications from this monitor will automatically insert its
              triggering tags into the title.
              Default: True
              Examples:

                

                  True:
                      [Triggered on {host:h1}] Monitor Title

a dictionary of thresholds by threshold
              type. Currently we have two threshold types for metric alerts:
              critical and warning. Critical is defined in the query, but can
              also be specified in this option. Warning threshold can only be
              specified using the thresholds option.
              Example: {'critical': 90, 'warning': 80}

requests.name: Add Monitor Mute All
requests.description:
Muting will prevent all monitors from notifying through email and posts
        to the event stream. State changes will only be visible by checking
        the alert page.

requests.name: Add Monitor Unmute All
requests.description:
Disables muting all monitors. Throws an error if mute all was
        not enabled previously.

requests.name: Put User Handle
requests.description: Can only be used with application keys belonging to administrators.

requests.name: Get Graph Embed
requests.description: Gets a list of previously created embeddable graphs.

requests.name: Get Graph Embed Embed
requests.description: Get the HTML fragment for a previously generated embed with embed_id.
